item.title: Whole footpath needs clearing and resurfacing, 13th November
item.description:
The entire stretch of footpath requires work. It is so uneven and when covered in slippery leaves is a disaster waiting to happen. The bushes need cutting back, the pathway needs resurfacing and the leaves need clearing regularly at this time of year. Some dog poo bins wouldn't go a miss either as it's constantly littered in dog mess.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Denbigh Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other problem, 13th November
item.description:
Please could you jet the gullies as marked on the plan to prevent flooding outside the Primary School
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaf debris, 13th November
item.description:
Our small street is heavily tree lined and a substantial amount of leaf buildup has now been churned into heaps of dirty mulch. This continuously blocks our street drains and endangers our homes to flooding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Orrisdale Terrace, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Marking not clearly visible, 13th November

item.title: Leaves and mud causing slippery path, 13th November
item.description:
The pathway (alleyway) between Brookfield Road and the entrance to Dinglewell School has a large amount of leaves and mud which is causing a very slippery surface. Lots of children and adults use this alleyway so I'm a bit concerned it's going to cause someone to slip and fall and hurt themselves. It's been like this for a few weeks but getting worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dip causing debris build up and grass growing into road, 13th November
item.description:
The dropped kerb is too low and the tarmac is missing in parts so that a large amount of debris builds up from the local trees etc and settles there. I cleaned it out a year ago but its come back already. You can see from the photos how the grass is growing into the road causing yet more of a hinderance to the flow of water and debris away, even though rained heavily yesterday 12 Nov

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Painswick Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
